Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: jkaposta
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, the staff made you feel welcome. Every single member treated you professionally and warmly willing to offer suggestions on whatever you might ask. Everything was clean all the time- inside our suite and outside our room. The guests, first time visitors, and those back for their 16th time, mingled, smiled and created the homiest of atmospheres (which I think starts with the hotel's philosophy of breakfast included and "cocktail hour." My husband and I were in San Diego as tourists for 12 days, staying at Sommerset the entire time. Rooming at such an affordable place enabled us to really see a lot since we didn't have to return sooner. While I can't say it was peaceful, I can't imagine any hotel being quiet in S.D.--it's a city that's got a lot going on, starting with traffic. I hate noise and was not bothered by the ambulances-you don't really sit in your room in a place like S.D. If you're staying in a suite, you know the benefits--works great for us--I like to read to unwind, my husband to work on the computer and/or watch tv. The amount of space for the money is unbelievable. We rented a car and the parking was tight, again--you're in the city--it's to be expected. As for areas where they fell short: We came back so tired at night that we would have liked more options with ordering dinner in. And, although the staff was helpful, a couple of times I felt that the help offered wasn't as insider-oriented or tailored to what we'd expressed as our interests.needs as it could have been. (i.e.-no true concierge concept like you get in many hotels). I'm glad we did our own homework or we would have only seen the big stuff. Kudos to Luis (reception-evenings) and Marta (breakfast cafe)--they're both friendly and fun, and made our stay memorable!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: iMarkDD
Reviews.Content: There is no better place to stay if you are visiting the Hillcrest area. It's within walking distance to all of the restaurants, bars, clubs, etc. It's very clean, pretty quiet, and that staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating. I love visiting San Diego for weekend getaways and I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Sommerset Suites Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shurtliffp
Reviews.Content: My stay was mostly business but the room was so comfortable and the pool was so clean and warm it made my stay feel like a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Staff here makes me feel like I'm home!”
Reviews.Author: Sheli L
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Diego quite a bit on business. I like to rotate where I stay to break the monotony. I keep coming back here because they make me feel so welcome. Rooms are large and comfortable with the kitchen in each room. Great place for families or those here on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: Pam B
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Diego for our son's graduation from marine bootcamp at MCRD. The location couldn't have been better to get to the base as Gate 5 was right at the end of Washington Street. It was really nice to not have to worry about getting lost. We had close access to highways and had no problem getting around the city. We did some site seeing with our son and family, there were 6 of us total, before coming home and it was great to have a suite where we could all be together. Our booking price for this suite was at least $100 cheaper than the other local suite hotels and we had a separate bedroom. Many of the suites are more along the lines of a studio apartment and if they weren't they started at around $250-300 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Suites Hotel in Hillcrest”
Reviews.Author: zaphod1314
Reviews.Content: My wife , 17 year old daughter, and I had an extremely pleasent seven night stay in one of the hotels one bedroom suites. After checking the usual hotel booking sites we actually got the best deal on the hotels own website. The room/suite was surprisingly large, (we have actually rented smaller apartments), and extremely well apointed. The separate bedroom contained the onsuite bathroom, a large walk-in cupboard/closet, kingsize bed and large LCD TV, with a window overlooking the balcony. The lounge area again was very well appointed, containing the sofa/bed, (acceptably comfortable) according to daughter, and very easy to set up/ put away. The kitchen area had everything you would need from large fridge to full size electric cooker. Worthy of a mention are the domestic staff, who were always pleasent and willing to help. This hotel will be the first one we check on our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I was expecting more”
Reviews.Author: Rafabozzolla
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Sommerset Suites in January. First of all, there is absolutely nothing really wrong with this hotel, but I just wasn't impressed. The main problem is that it really needs an update. The common areas are really showing their age. Kudos to the photographer because the website is makes it look a lot nicer than the hotel is. My room was very spacious with a full kitchen and full-sized refrigerator and a nice balcony. The decor was very old and almost tacky (especially the recliner seat by the bed, but I guess Americans like that sort of stuff.) but everything worked as it should. The bathrobes on the closet are a nice touch. The best thing is parking: At $6 a day, it is quite reasonable for SoCa. The low is breakfast... not many options and it can get very, very crowded. Since I paid around $100 I was willing to overlook the flaws. If I had paid more I would have expected a much nicer hotel. If you are on a budget, it can be a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Hillcrest”
Reviews.Author: Seth G
Reviews.Content: The Sommerset Suites is a great bargain in a great neighborhood. The rooms are large and include kitchenettes, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the location and value is fantastic - great access to restaurants, Balboa Park and Mission Hills. The best place to be in San Diego if you don't have to be on the beach. I've stayed multiple times for both work and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Always Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Stnhsej
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sommerset Suites Hotel in San Diego several times and I have always found the staff very friendly and accommodating. I usually stay for around a week and having the laundry facility is a plus. The hotel rooms are comfortable, clean and have a nice kitchen area. The location of the hotel allows you to easily get to the Downtown area or access the highway system. I always recommed this hotel to my business associates and friends traveling in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location (near Hospitals) for good price”
Reviews.Author: aboyer8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sommerset Suites while on a business trip at UCSD Hospital. I enjoyed my stay there very much. The hotel is perfectly located. It is a few block from the main highway, but not right on top of it. So you can easily get to downtown or the beach without any trouble. It is within walking distance to all the hospitals and offices. There is a fabulous dining and shopping district right across the street. Pretty much anything you are in the mood for you can get within a 5 minute walk. Being a fairly young female and traveling alone, I am always careful of my surroundings. I felt safe walking around at night and being in the hotel alone. The hotel itself is nice. It is a simple hotel, nothing really fancy about it. But it is comfortable and clean. The rooms are very large! And comes with a full kitchen complete with a closet full of kitchen utensils and supplies. While my room only had a king, I felt as though with the right beds, you could comfortably sleep 4-5 people easily. The bathroom was nice and clean with a good amount of counter space. The hotel has a pool and hottub. I did not get the chance to go in, but I walked around it and saw people in there enjoying it. It has a good amount of parking underneath the hotel. The hotel served a wonderful breakfast with freshly made waffles, eggs, cereal, etc. The hotel staff was so wonderful and friendly. They were quick to help me when I got locked out of my room and had great recommendations for food and fun local places. If you are looking for a nice hotel around the hospitals and even a little out of downtown but still close to everything, this is a great hotel. It is reasonable priced, has great features, and can really accommodate anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain for the service and location in Hillcrest”
Reviews.Author: loustyle
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Sommerset, and will continue to be my hotel of choice as long as they keep up their good job. For a 3-4ish star hotel, it has spacious rooms that are clean, and decent furniture. Mattress is comfortable as long as you're okay with a little softness. Two small things -- the dining room table was wobbly, but a repair person QUICKLY replaced it with a fine table. Second, the toilet flushing was somewhat weak, and cause one plunging experience -- again, the hotel tech staff we're on it immediately. Overall, I recommend without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: grantz123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in January 2012 in order to attend our son's graduation from boot camp at MCRD. The accommodations were perfect for our family of four - two adults and two toddlers. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and neat and having a full kitchen was a real bonus for the family. The best part of all was the location - MCRD, Balboa Park, Sea World, even downtown are all very close. Dozens of restaurants and several shops are an easy walk in the Hillcrest neighborhood - even for our two-year old. I offer two caveats: a hospital is next door, so there are occasional ambulance sirens; the pool is only 3 feet deep, so serious lap swimmers may struggle to exercise. If you need to work out, I think they have a discount at the 24-Hr. fitness across the street. Go. It's a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Titeman
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here numerous times and always found the staff friendly, helpful and willing to do whatever it took to make our stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved the pool !”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravellers4
Reviews.Content: Our family including 2 children (aged 6 & 9) stayed here in October 2011 as part of our month long holiday to America. Our room had two double beds in a separte room, and a full kitchen with seperate dining/living area with balcony. It was great to have lots of room rather than a single hotel room, however like many accomodations in America they do not have single beds for children. It was good to cook meals rather than eat out every night. A large supermarket is only about 5-6 blocks away (10mins walk). Although this accomodation is located right next to a hospital we heard no noise, except for the occassional helicopter which our boiys enjoyed watching land. great undercover parking, lots of cafes and restuarants within walking distance. The kids loved the pool after being out all day sightseeing and often had the pool to themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: LadyJLasVegas
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Sommerset Suites on my last 4 business trips to San Diego. The hotel is on the edge of Hillcrest, half a block from lots of great restaurants. The rooms are comfortable, clean, well appointed. It's lovely to be able to make a meal or eat a meal in comfort. There's secure parking if you need it. I didn't and I walked almost everywhere I needed to go. Breakfast is ok, not exciting but plenty to eat, with a very helpful woman in charge. I've stayed in the 1 room and 2 room suites. LOVE the bigger suites! Absolutely all the comfort of your own apartment. There's free WiFi and the staff is knowledgeable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: NatureMom50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week over the Christmas holidays. I was hesitant to book at first because the price seemed too good to be true. It is centrally located in the charming Hillcrest neighborhood, close to Balboa Park and within walking distance of many fascinating restaurants and shops. As a family visiting our adult son for the holiday, we booked a suite with 2 beds in a separate bedroom and a big sleeper sofa in the living room. We had a complete, usable kitchen, full -size fridge, stove, dishwasher. Comfy beds, two flat screen TVs, 2 closets, huge bathroom with stacks of towels. Washers and dryers a couple floors up. And a complete hot breakfast in the breakfast room every morning. The only drawback was the noise from the freeway right below us, it made our lovely balcony pretty hard to tolerate, ask for a room on any other side of the building. Hotel is clean and well maintained, safe neighborhood, I had no concerns if I went for a walk alone. Don't worry about the hospitals and their sirens, if you live in any city the noise level is pretty normal. And a very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for the nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Crystal L
Reviews.Content: Our daughter had to have surgery and the staff here at Sommerset Suites were outstanding with all our needs. We've stayed here a few times now and each time is better. The staff was so understanding and went above and beyond to make us comfortable. The unit was always cleaned and left in immaculate shape. The breakfast waitress is so kind and friendly and always willing to help, and kept the breakfast bar clean. The location is perfect for all your needs, convenient walking distances to great eateries and stores you may need. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Work and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: CityofDust
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay, the staff is friendly and very helpful. We were close to several restaurants and Balbo Park. Parking onsite and easy to get where we needed to be in the city. We had to change rooms due to a sink issue, but the staff was very helpful and wanted to make sure our stay was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: mandypdx
Reviews.Content: We got a great cyber monday deal here, which made the huge room even better. The staff was genuinely nice, and the location near restaurants and balboa park was fantastic. Our room was away from the street and noise wasn't an issue. There could be some more decoration on the walls--the place looked a little spartan perhaps because of its size. Other than that, it was a great stay in an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Tontenn
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to find this place. The reviews werent flash but I can only say this was a gem. When your in San Diego stay here. Out of the main CBD but very big rooms, clean and well appointed. I missed out on breakfast after a big night out and only stayed the one night but couldnt fault them. Another great place to keep in the memory bank when im back in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and so clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Jane E
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short San Diego visit and loved our time at this hotel. We booked through Priceline and were pleasantly surprised at the quality and amenities for the price we paid. We had a suite and the kitchen was awesome. Each room has a small deck and two deck chairs also. The lobby is warm and inviting. The dining area is comfortable and two evenings a week the hotel offers free wine and appetizers. The breakfast offerings were nice as well. This is one of the cleanest hotels we have ever stayed at. The neighborhood is funky and fun and some of the best food anywhere. One thing we noticed about not only this hotel but other business in the Hillcrest neighborhood was exceptional customer service. The staff at this hotel smile ALOT! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “A good deal, lots of reasons to stay here”
Reviews.Author: merry1234
Reviews.Content: This is in the Hillcrest area - lots of incredible restaurants and shops, Whole Foods in walking distance (Washington St. and University Ave.), only a mile from Balboa Park and the Zoo. Best thing about it, the price and the fact that it has a kitchen, dining room table and living room with couch, separate from the bedroom. Because of that we were able to have our family members come to 'our place' to visit. Nice to have the option, nice to be able to "eat in", or save money by cooking/fixing our own drinks/snacks/meals. Only thing to consider is that it can be noisy at times, because several hospitals are nearby, there are sirens, so keep the windows closed and request an upper floor. Service is great, amenities like 'wine and cheese happy hour" in the winter and BBQ in the summer are a treat. This was my second time to stay here, I love it, and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: For years my wife and I have enjoyed multiple-day stays at this superb hotel. The reasons are obvious: excellent location, spacious rooms, easy access to great and varied restaurants, affordable rates. Other reasons are not so obvious, beginning with the cordial staff that always manages to create a friendly atmosphere. From top to bottom, these folks are entirely committed to making your stay memorable. At other places, managers are often unavailable. At Sommerset Suites Hotel the manager himself barbecues for you several nights a week and sports a big, genuine smile. What more could one ask?

Reviews.Title: “From a local's perspective...”
Reviews.Author: b0nv0yage2007
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times (when my own house has been unavailable for various reasons) because it's a deal...and, it's not a chain (at least not a major one). First of all...the location is great. You can walk to many good coffeehouses, restaurants and shops in Hillcrest...and, Landmark Theaters are only a 1/2 block away. If you don't mind a long walk, you can make it to Balboa Park. The rooms are more like small very basic apartments with a compact kitchen, living room, bedroom, and bathroom. All the little extras - like a blowdryer and iron - are included in the rooms. Service here is great...they even give you free BBQ'd food on Fridays. Their free breakfast is better than the typical continental (waffle maker!) and is self-served up in a cute room by the pool. Pool area is small, but well kept.

Reviews.Title: “I feel like I am at home when I stay at Sommerset Suites!”
Reviews.Author: SouthCali82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love this hotel! We are from Cabo, a tourist destination with 5 star resorts and we love to travel to US cities like Vegas, San Diego, LA, etc! We visit San Diego 3-4 times a year and we love staying at Sommerset Suites! The rooms are very spacious, like your own 1 bedroom apartment. It includes a daily continental breakfast, go visit Martha for breakfast, she is so sweet and friendly and remembers since the first time we stayed there. Martha is now like family to us!! The value for your money is fantastic! At $100 a night for a full kitchen, dining, living and bedroom with spacious bathroom is fantastic. I wish I could take this hotel with me to every city I visit! We visited Toronto in September and we paid over $190 a night for a hotel room half as nice and half as big! Sommerset is close to everything: shopping, pharmacies, supermarkets, several restaurants right across the street, the airport, down town gas lamp, Fashion Valley mall, Mission Valley mall, the 5, 8, 163 and 805 freeways, the harbor, and minutes from the beach, Zoo, and Sea World!! Is also perfect to stay at when you are going to Gualcom stadium!! We have stayed at this hotel over 6 times and I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else! Try their fresh fruit waters and fresh chocolate chip cookies in the lobby, they are delish! Enjoy this fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, helpful, superb location and very pleasant place to be.”
Reviews.Author: Dee J
Reviews.Content: Some travel is not about a holiday! Flying in from England because my Mum was in ICU at a nearby hospital I really appreciated this `Home from home' where I could relax and try to de-stress from a day in the hospital. Every single person I came into contact here went out of their way to help me and point me in the right direction. My suite was just what I needed. I did manage to see one or two of the interesting sights and will definitely spend more time here in happier times!! Found it on the UCSD hospital website! Dee Jones

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great location in town, fairly priced”
Reviews.Author: CCL_JO
Reviews.Content: Although not a fancy hotel, we found the staff friendly, the room clean, the kitchenette small but adequate, the wifi usable, and the pool small but good enough for a quick swim. The location was great for being in the city, near Balboa park, with many good restaurants nearby and walkable. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Value-priced Gem in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Susan S
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several tiimes now and in each instance have found the room to be very comfortable and clean. They even passed my 80-year-old mother's cleanliness test...and that's saying something. We both found the beds to be very comfortable and the kitchenette allowed us to keep fresh fruits and veggies on hand. The staff are very helpful and were especially attentive to my mother. I travel a great deal and hotels like the Sommeset Suites are a rare find. My next stay is already booked.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a go!”
Reviews.Author: queer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for those keen to stay close to the gay district, Hillcrest. I happened upon Somerset Suites hotel almost by chance. Once I reached my room I noticed it had something of a poor Internet connection; it happens. Notifying Reception, I was quickly called back by Erin, the general manager. He was immediately on the case and someone promptly helped me move my bags (I am disabled) and without asking. The alternative room was ideal, with an excellent Internet connection. I have so enjoyed the hotel, it's locale and the staff's receptiveness I am staying a third (unscheduled) night.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Fredrik R
Reviews.Content: I think the value for money is about right. The suites are big, the beds are comfortable. I couldn't really find anything to complain about. The breakfast is very basic (i.e. nothing fresh; cereal, milk, toast, juice, like any other basic motel). I didn't deal much with the staff, but they seemed professional when I did. If you like to stay fit while traveling, they offered free gym vouchers at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, spacious accommodation In Hillcrest area of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: southlondonerSE27
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and found the accommodation at the Sommerset Suites to be comfortable & clean. There was a well appointed kitchen (for a hotel), including a cooker with oven, full size fridge, & small freezer compartment, microwave, dishwasher, coffee maker. All cutlery, dishes etc. in our room were clean. The room we were staying in had a balcony at the back of the hotel. We were not at all bothered by noises from ambulances or anything else. But then again coming from South London, hearing emergency services in the middle of the night is not an unusual occurrence so maybe it just passed us by. Room was spacious and the bed was comfortable and linen was clean. Shower was over the bath-all fine. Flat screen TV. Breakfast was cereals, waffles, juices, pots of yoghurt, hot drinks, boiled eggs. Some fresh fruit. OK for what it was- but let down by use of butter substitute rather than proper butter. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Location was excellent for Hillcrest which seemed to be a lively & up & coming area, with many enticing places to eat & drink & I wished we had been able to explore the locale more than time allowed on this trip. We were able to walk from the hotel to downtown & the Gaslamp quarter through Balboa Park (approx 25 mins) and after a full day's sightseeing took a cab to return to the hotel which seemed reasonable at $11. We had hired a large SUV and had no problems parking in the hotel garage- this was extra at $7 a day

Reviews.Title: “Would get a negative rating if possible; avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: hsmomcharlottenc
Reviews.Content: First the pros--large suites; Cons--everything else. This hotel is absolutely miserable. Terrible location surrounded on three sides by hospitals, so one hears sirens all night. When there are no sirens, the highway is on the fourth side and nothing has been done to dampen the noise. There are exterior doors to the suites, single pain sliding glass doors to the balconies, and small air wall unit air conditioners that don't drown out the traffic. Don't be fooled by the pictures on their website--this clearly used to be a 1970s apartment building converted badly to a hotel. The cabinets were painted over and cracked granite countertops installed. Not a door in the place closed correctly--cabinet nor bathroom. The dishes in the cabinets were dirty with food still on them, there were not adequate pans, and the range was tiny. The pool was a joke--about the size of a four person hot tub and only three feet deep. The front desk person was curt and unfriendly. The parking is under the building, and the spaces were miniscule. Breakfast was pretty sparse also. Avoid this hotel when in San Diego; there has to be somewhere better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent,clean,friendly,and good value place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Stuey62
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the suite, service and value for money. Staff were friendly, and helpful. Great location for the gay traveller and close to the Hill Crest scene. Pool and outdoor spa area clean and sunny. Self service laundry facilities great as well!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad ratings”
Reviews.Author: Lovetophotograph
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Sommerset Suites. This time we used it as a base for a photo tour we were leading. Jen worked with us while we were determining the number of rooms we needed and was very helpful. The hotel is extremely well located with easy freeway access, close proximity to Balboa Park, easy access to downtown and the airport, and within walking distance of a variety of good restaurants, CVS, and Whole Foods. We also wanted a hotel with cooking facilities for folks who prefer to eat in rather than going out for every meal. The kitchen is adequately furnished and the staff runs the dishwasher every day for you. The hotel is situated near a hospital and during the day you hear emergency vehicles but they are not a problem at night. Most rooms have had their windows treated to cut down on street noise since it is located on a busy road. Like any hotel you can get noisy neighbors but we only encountered that one night. (We have gotten where we always take a small sound machine with us that provides white noise and helps cover up most noise because it seems that noisy neighbors are found in many hotels.) We were driving mini vans and the parking spaces in the garage were a bit tight but then we found this to be true pretty much everywhere in San Diego where parking is at a premium. I felt the staff went the extra mile for us. They were painting the building while we were there and someone had taken the time to cover my car in a huge sheet of plastic so it wouldn't get paint on it. We're not talking a hotel that is ultra fancy but it's affordable, clean, comfortable (the beds are great), the rooms are large, the breakfast is comparable to most chain hotel breakfasts, it is very well located for exploring San Diego and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: YakWa3
Reviews.Content: Our group came to San Diego for a wedding. We found the Sommerset Suites ideal for our needs. It is conveniently located with good access and restaurants in the area. Access to the airport is easy on city streets (took about 15-20 minutes max) and to the freeway that will take you anywhere you want to go. The staff were friendly and responsive. The units are clean and comfortable and reasonably priced for the area. I would recommend to anyone who needed a place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: anita l
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here while in town for my daughter's wedding. We had 7 rooms and guests from 3 different states all arriving at different dates and times. The staff and especially the property manager did everything they could to make our stay as enjoyable as could be. They hooked us up with excellent transportation to and from the airport and the wedding venue for 13 guests. The manager (Ms.Cruz) also surprised our son who was married the month before and on a honeymoon road trip with a beautiful gift basket with champagne when he arrived. I have stayed here a couple of times before and always enjoy how close it is to everything fun to do in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: donegalboy25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in October and were pleasantly surprised. We originally only planned to stay for one night as it was the first place we arrived at after exiting the freeway. The rooms etc may not be ultra modern, but they were spotlessly clean and huge!! The staff were excellent and gave loads of helpful local information and so we decided to make this our base to explore San Diego. Breakfast was included in the rate and was nice, the lady serving it was really funny and kept us entertained. There is a pool etc but we didnt use it as the weather was fab and we hit the beach instead! Overall this place is a smashing base to explore San Diego and the nightlife etc in Hillcrest was brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, good location, don't expect glamour”
Reviews.Author: Peter100
Reviews.Content: Apparently the suites are ex doctors' accommodation for trainees at the nearby hospital. They've clearly been improved since then but I'd suggest some furnishings, the cooker etc and the bathrooms are original and could do with updating. The place is clean and functional but don't expect a glam hotel. That said, the staff are great... Especially Jen in reception and wonderful Martha at breakfast.. And the location excellent for Hillcrest and the surrounds plus easy freeway access. Beware though this means there can be traffic noise although it never disturbed us. Prices not dirt cheap but pretty average for San Diego. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Friends and Family Shared Memories”
Reviews.Author: Waldwick
Reviews.Content: This property was our gathering point for the Celebration of Life for my partner. Family and friends gathered from all over to share stories, laughs and memories of him. We were within walking distance to everything. No one really needed a car and this made it much easier for all. The suites were large and very clean. Housekeeping staff and the breakfast staff were always smiling and doing a wonderful job. The front desk staff was knowledgeable and extremely helpful with "tourist" suggestions. Jennifer Cruz in Reservations was always available and took extra care of or small group.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, start to finish”
Reviews.Author: Divababs
Reviews.Content: It began with the excellent assistance I received from Jennifer and staff in re to setting up accommodations for 30 guests and seeing that it was carried through without missing a beat. We were greeted with wonderfully refreshing fruit infused waters at check-in desk, and reservations were handled professionally. Every effort was made to assist and follow through with plan. Our room was very comfortable, clean and quiet with a view over the pool. We were allowed early check-in and late check-out. Hotel is situated within walking distance to everything you could want, and every type of food. Park and walk.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Jac123Denver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sommerset in Hillcrest during the blackout. We could not believe how all the staff really stepped it up and provided people in need with comfort and a sense of community. All hands were on deck during the outage to accommodate guest. The most amazing thing was seeing the staff out there with head lamps and tiki torches BBQing into the night for the guest. Aside from the blackout, the rooms were clean and spacious and the location is great. There was also free internet and free breakfast in the morning. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lahomerun
Reviews.Content: Had a long night and just wanted to go to bed. The lobby was great and Bonita who checked us in was very nice and very friendly. Every time we passed by the Lobby, she knew who we were and always made a point to say Hi. The Hotel Location can't be beat. Its walking distance to Hillcrest, restaurants and the grocery store. The rooms were huge, as well as the balcony. I would definitely stay here again. Actually I am but this time staying for a lot longer and going with my Softball team to San Diego and we booked our rooms here. Thank you Aron & Bonita for your hospitality

Reviews.Title: “We were not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DEHANSEN
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews and ratings. We were very happy with everything about this hotel! We definetaley recommend this hotel to everyone. It has a great location. Great employees that made our stay very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Well located to Balboa Park Museums and Zoo”
Reviews.Author: PasCaLady
Reviews.Content: Located near Balboa Park in area with a large number of good restaurants. A bit worn but very clean and comfortable. Quiet. Large kitchen and pantry. Great shower. Comfortable beds. Free breakfast certainly ample. Staff were all very cordial and pleasant except for day desk clerk, who was rather curt. A 'thank you' and 'come back again' would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: dhen
Reviews.Content: There were some definite good and not so good about our 3 night stay at the Sommerset. We stayed here with two grand kids ages 7 and 10. First the good. A perfect location. Easy driving to both Sea World and the Zoo. Lots of places to eat at nearby. The pool, though small, was a perfect size for the grand kids and they spent two hours at the pool on two of the afternoons. The staff was great. The breakfast was adequate but we especially appreciated that there were 2-3 staff members helping to clean up, cook the waffles and keep everything well stocked each morning. Our room on the 4th floor had been recently painted and the kitchen was large and took care of all our needs.The living area was spacious enough as was the separate bedroom and bath. I didn't notice any dirty carpets anywhere that we went in the hotel as the previous reviewers have suggested . The beds were comfortable had soft pillows, nice sheets and comforters. Lots of easy access parking. Didn't have any of the noise issues the previous reviewers had. Guess we had more "considerate" guests during our stay. Don't really feel a family hotel should be blamed for children running in the hallways. It seems like that is more a issue of "parenting!" We actually seemed to have far more adults occupying the hotel during our stay than families. The only bothersome noise we had were from the occasional sirens from the ambulances passing by the hotel to the nearby hospital. The Not So Good: The beds were only doubles which was hard to adjust to when you sleep on a King. The grand kids, who usually sleep in their own beds at home, were definitely cramped for space. Strangely, the kitchen had dishes and utensils but no dish soap, towels or sponge. Guess we were suppose to buy those things at the Albertsons down the street. The overall feel of the room was a bit dated with older t v's and furniture. We prepaid our bill on the internet and it was misleading. It seemed to say the bill was all inclusive but at check out had to pay the taxes as an added amount. The $7 parking per night seemed a bit ridiculous for the location. Would I recommend this hotel to friends? Probably, with some of the reservations I stated above.

Reviews.Title: “Also Dissappointed overall”
Reviews.Author: calgarytroy
Reviews.Content: Very similar to the last review....booked based on reviews, ranking, and location. We arrived to wonderful friendly staff that offered advice, maps, and coupons. Upon walking to, and entering room, rating was falling... also noticed the old dirty carpet, and while technically a suite, it was very " cozy ", but still acceptable. Where it lost more points was on the thin walls - from the noisy couple above us during the night, to the kids running down the halls in the morning, to the speaker right outside my window playing the lobby music all night ( which the clerk did turn off as soon as I mentioned it - after midnight ). A couple positives were the decent breakfast, again helped by the nice staff, and the central location - it was max 20 minutes ( usually 10 ) to where ever in the city we were going. The price was OK, and the overal cleanliness was OK, with the bad points mentioned plus little things, we would not stay there again, or recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “We were dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: LATraveller_12
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based only on the reviews and the high ranking we found on TripAdvisor. But we were extremely dissapointed by the quality of this hotel. The good: the service and the friendliness of the staff, the central location The bad: dirty carpet, small beds, bad appliances, leaking and noisy AC, old tvs, bad coffee, not enough glasses/cups, only one chair on the balcony for a 6 person suite, not enough towels, not enough chairs in the room, no room to move around in the bedroom, extremely small swimming pool and jacuzzi, rooms facing the parking and garbage area of the neighboring building. Overall the price you pay is much bigger than the accomodation you receive.

Reviews.Title: “There's a lot you'll like”
Reviews.Author: EC_Bill
Reviews.Content: You drive up and the place looks pretty unimpressive. But then you meet the front desk people and you discover that they'll do whatever then can to make sure you have an enjoyable stay. The suites are not the newest, but they're big and comfy, with a full kitchen. I'd say the single best thing about this hotel is the location, giving you easy access to the Zoo, Sea World, Gaslamp Quarter, Old Town and the airport. And you're walking distance from some really great restaurants in the Hillcrest area (We LOVED Sambuca.) The free breakfasts were tasty with lots of variety, and the ladies who assist you were delightful. There's also a free cookout on Friday nights that we really enjoyed. The pool and hot tub were refreshing, especially after long days of sightseeing. Two minor quibbles: the parking garage is awfully tight. And the sirens of ambulances coming to the hospital across the street woke me up early 2 mornings. But I really liked Sommerset Suites and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great staff, but noisy area.”
Reviews.Author: LavenderHydrangea
Reviews.Content: The staff here is exceptionally wonderful. The room itself is sufficient with kitchen area and balcony overlooking the pool. It would have been nice to be able to open the door or hang out on the balcony, but the hotel is situated on a noisy street, next to a hospital with ambulances blaring throughout the day and near a highway entrance. Not that relaxing in that sense. However, the double pane glass doors do shut out the noise really well and we didn't have any problem falling asleep. It was pride weekend and the hotel hosted a nice bbq party for guests. Breakfast was the standard fare; cereal, make your own waffle etc. Parking was really nice to have because this area (Hillcrest) is difficult to find parking. Oh, and FREE wifi. We picked this hotel because it was walking distance to tons of restaurants and shopping, plus easy access to other neighborhoods. We were looking into relocating to SD and didn't want to be stuck downtown or at hotel row. This gave us a better sense of neighborhood scene vs. tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Family with Kids”
Reviews.Author: lcmo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed with Sommerset Suites for three nights in July 2011. Our room was spotless and spacious. While it obviously had not been renovated in some time, the everything was comfortable and fully functional. Most of all, the room was huge and had plenty of space for our family of four to spread out and not be on top of each other. The hotel is in walking distance to a number of very nice restaurants as well as to a CVS and a Whole Foods. While it is across the street from a hospital, we did not hear much traffic. It t is on a busy street that required more vigilance of our toddler than a quite street would have.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sommerset Suites... clean, nice rooms and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: StephanieLuvs2Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sommerset Suites with my husband and 5 1/2 month old daughter over Memorial Day Weekend, 2011. We originally were planning to book with Sunburst Court Inn (also a great place to stay), but they were booked, so we were referred to Sommerset. Location was very convenient to my family's home and to the zoo, Sea World, Balboa Park, and downtown. We loved the suite setup, as we could put our daughter to sleep in the bedroom and utilize the living area. The suite had a fully equipped kitchen and a balcony. Some previous reviewers noted the closeness of the hotel to the hospitals, but we were not woken by sirens... maybe heard a total of 3 the whole stay. Great complimentary breakfast each morning, nice pool area... overall, great place to stay, with or without children!

Reviews.Title: “I WILL ALWAYS COME BACK”
Reviews.Author: Waterbaby16
Reviews.Content: Sommerset Suites is an excellent hotel in an ideal neighbourhood. The staff are outstanding, always there to help in any way possible. It is fun to be a guest and the summer Friday night Bar-B-Que's are great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and value of Sommerset Suites”
Reviews.Author: rlofano2
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the what we got for our money! The continental breakfast was much appreciated too.

Reviews.Title: “I could live in one of these lovely suites!”
Reviews.Author: sandiegogirl4ever
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at SS several times over the last 3 years. I love the rooms, the staff and the facility! I highly recommend it! Close to many fabulous restaurants and shopping in Hillcrest, close to 8, 5 and 163, the zoo, Balboa Park...can't beat it for the price and the staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: AlexKBH
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 3 nights here in June 2011 and had a suite with 2 king beds in the bedroom and a full-size sofa bed in the living area. The suite was large with a well-stocked kitchen area, was clean and very well maintained. We thought it was comfortable enough even for longer stays up to a month. Despite its location surrounded by various medical centers and hospitals and Washington St just in front of our room, we found it quiet and pleasant. Location was pleasant and we felt safe even walking at night to the many eateries and supermarkets located nearby. Free wifi reception was good. The car park costs USD6 per night and was always easy to find a parking space. Breakfast was the usual selection of juices, breads, cereals, fruits and pancakes. Staff was polite. Certainly a place we'll return to stay on future visits to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but good”
Reviews.Author: JimCayman
Reviews.Content: Simple hotel good value...nice breakfast....close to resturants and very close to San Diego Zoo...ok rooms...good parking...not much views only hospitals around...but its somewhere nice to sleep...had washer and dryers on 4th floor came in handy...good internet service.. The negatives carpets need cleaning not just vacuuming...some paint would go a long way in the rooms and in the corridor...

Reviews.Title: “Decent place but not over the top”
Reviews.Author: Awful_Kgp
Reviews.Content: We found the place somewhat cramped for the group of six that we were but it did have all the mod cons --however with one bathroom the going was tough ! Breakfast however was the best we had in the entire west coast US trip with good variety --- we were there for three nights and it was a decent stay but could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend highly enough!”
Reviews.Author: alexr94
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a conference and we stayed here for 2 nights before moving to the conference hotel down by the harbor. We picked it based on the reviews here and I am so glad we did! This place is a gem. The staff were friendly and welcoming and the room was great-- very big and so comfortable (loved that bed!) Also clean and well stocked. As people have said, the free coffee and popcorn and chocolate are a great touch. The pool area was right outside my room but the noise wasn't bad, and it was a great place to relax and sunbathe, BBQ there too on Fridays. I saw someone wrote on here that it was in the shade-- yes it was, in the evening!! The breakfast included was also great--coffee, waffles, cereal, toast, bagels, juice. The breakfast area is quite small so we brought ours outside or to our rooms. Location is great, it's close enough to the airport and also to the downtown area. We walked straight down 5th avenue to the gaslamp district, through Balboa park, was great!! Also nearby are great food places, a 24 hour pharmacy, etc. The free wifi is also brilliant (and is not slow at all). The hospital thing wasn't a problem at all. I heard a few sirens but nothing I haven't heard before living in a city. Also the surrounding area felt safe I wasn't worried about walking around alone. I moved to the Sheraton Marina hotel-- a 4 star hotel-- and it is nowhere near as great as this place!! Here we are paying ridiculous prices just for a sea view and the breakfast and service is not as good. Definitely stay here you won't regret it, we didn't want to leave! Such a brilliant find!

Reviews.Title: “Good staff...but noisy location!”
Reviews.Author: Kitty1515
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week because a family member was in hospital behind hotel...did not need car to go there ...just a walk across lot in back. But could not leave windows or doors open for air as traffic and ambulance noise was quite annoying. No exercuse room...small pool (in shade) and only luke warm jacuzzi a definite disappoinment. Breakfast was typical... waffles and hard boiled eggs a plus... My kitchen suite did not supply a toaster and only had 3 teeny tiny bowls and 3 reg. plates and no hot pads...or cookie sheets...a regular size coffeemaker would have been nice also. Cupboards and drawers in kitchen and bath are old and stick a little.. Beds were comfy. Neighborhood is mixed...as I saw a few homeless drinking and with can carts out back ...but felt safe walking in Hillcrest. Good eats...Saigon and Broadway Pizza...and Choc-a-lat on University.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: IMA7588
Reviews.Content: Booked here based on TripAdvisor reviews and was not at all disappointed. Very clean hotel, nice spacious one bedroom suite felt like a small apartment (we were one adult and one 8 year old child). The free breakfast was a very nice variety (waffles, bagels, hot and cold cereal, fresh fruit) and the woman serving was so friendly and helpful I would have left a tip even if the tip jar wasn't available. Front desk staff were also very helpful, providing maps and tips for getting around. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: kephart
Reviews.Content: Room was nice!! Staff was nice! Location was perfect!!!!!!!!!!!! Parking at the hotel was inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “consistent with every stay”
Reviews.Author: jaime664
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here for many years, I continue to find the facilities to be in very good shape, rooms with ample space and the staff are always efficient and friendly. The location is central to San Diego with excellent restaurants and entertainment within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: happytravels2
Reviews.Content: My brother and I, who were visiting San Diego for my son's wedding, chose this hotel based on the great reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. Our suite was spacious and spotlessly clean. Every staff member we met during our stay there was very friendly and helpful. Check-in and check-out was handled very efficiently. The front desk staff recommended a fabulous place nearby for a full hot breakfast on the morning we checked out. The location was perfect for us and our room was quiet. Because this hotel is so close to the hospital, ambulance sirens are occasionally heard, but we expected this and it did not bother us at all. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: busynana
Reviews.Content: The hotel was further away from shopping and dining than I would prefer. The emenities of the hotel however, were great. The room was clean and well kept. It is a bit older but in good repair and loved the coffee pot, and the great space of the one bedroom suite. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the continental breakfast great. Loved the fresh served waffles! All in all a good experience. What I didn't realize is this hotel caters to people who are staying close to the hospital(s) in order to be close to loved ones. The place is definitely perfect for that.

Reviews.Title: “Second place next to home”
Reviews.Author: milevac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for few weeks and we extended for another month. I was happy I was able to negotiate our stay with Liz, the Asst. General Manager. The service is really good from the friendliness of the front desk, the fast service from maintenance, the welcoming greeting of Martha at the breakfast room and the help I got from Aron when I needed some papers to scan. I applaud the housekeeping for being honest and for taking care of our room. I am not the type of person who needs room service everyday but when I needed it, housekeeping did a superb job in changing all my linens and my child always leave my computer, my i touch etc but it is always stays in the room when we get home. The laundry room never fails me, it is always available no matter how full the hotel is. They have 4 washers and 4 dryers for everyone. I've been to other hotels and they usually have 2 washers and 1 dryer working for 80+ rooms, that's crazy. I like the staff the most, they are so friendly and they remember me and my kids. We feel like we are home and we felt safe during our entire stay. I highly recommend the place to anyone. I would be probably coming back again once we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel we stayed in”
Reviews.Author: bluesky039
Reviews.Content: we came from Australia and had a great trip ,we were very impressed with our room and all the staff you were all great thank you and yes we are busting to come back again now we are home we have to save up again and hope to come again soon thank you Matt and Michelle Linnett ps we tell every one to go over too .

Reviews.Title: “Location was awesome !”
Reviews.Author: billykidd
Reviews.Content: We travelled with 3 adults and 2 small children and had a great stay. The room was prefect for us and had the bathroom self-contained off the bedroom so our youngest could sleep in the separate living room in the large, hotel-supplied crib. We had a kitchen but only used it a couple of times during our 4 night stay as the Hillcrest neighbourhood had so many great little restaurants. Upon our arrival the front desk providered us a very detailed map of all the restaurants and shops in a 5 block radius. I've stayed in alot of hotels (some very high end aka overpriced) and have never received such a map. Also, they also supplied us countless printouts on Outlet shopping, malls etc. The staff at this hotel are the real stars. All of our requests were met promptly. They allowed us to use the laundry after hours because it best suited our needs and Martha was a real treat at breakfast each morning. She greeted us with smiles and even cooked our waffles, serviced us etc. What is unique is that the hotel serves a continental, breakfast bar style breakfast yet, unlike other hotels, continues to provide a very high level of service through Martha. Prior to booking I was concerned about the hotel being located next to hospitals and others on TripAdvisor have mentioned the sirens as being an irritant. In 4 nights, I heard 3 sirens. Not a problem. Our family will return to the Sommerset Suites on our next visit to San diego. Thank you !

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: LindaLuvly
Reviews.Content: The friendliest and most hospitable hotel I have ever stayed in. From the great waffles by Martha's welcome each morning, to the fresh baked cookies each afternoon, to the comfy beds, the smiles of all the housekeeping staff and the helpful tips from Liz and the office staff, this was the most delightful hotel stay. Our last night, there was even a cookout!! Could anyone ask for more?? We loved it and will be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: utahslc
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. It was clean and the rooms were a good size. We had a one bedroom, two bed suite. The beds were very comfortable. The staff was friendly. The breakfast was much more than I expected. The location was convenient. We really enjoyed our stay. I will definitely stay here again the next time I'm in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is by far the best place we have ever stayed.”
Reviews.Author: maidele
Reviews.Content: We have been coming here for 18 years because it is the nicest, friendliest, cleanest most well run place with a staff the excels and just works to make the guests happy. We find the manager, Aron, the dest help, especiallyBonita, the head of room services Norma and the wonderful Martha who greets us each morning to be superior. There is mnothing they won't do for us. i can't leave out the hourse staff like Romero, Jorge and Gustavo who are always there when we need help. I was delighted to asee the return of happy hour once a week. I truly believe that if it were 2 or 3 times a week it would enhance everyone's stay. It is not the quantity of food but the comraderie that makes it so great. Please consider this . We were delilghted to get newe sound proof windows and look forward to getting sound proof slider doors soon. We have already reserved our 6 week stay for next year and are saddened to have to leave now. This is just a wonderful place and has become our winter family. Even Kevin has come by to say hello and we appreciate his work in returning the happy hour to us. He is a delightful man.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, affordable”
Reviews.Author: IowaExplorergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sommerset Suites after finding it as part of a deal on one of those package websites (with our airfare). We wanted a suite since we were traveling with our young daughter (1.5 years) and my mom (mid 60s) so we needed some space for us all. It worked great. The full kitchen was wonderful (although simply equipped). They had two nice grills that we were planning on using but just got too busy. It's within walking distance of a Whole Foods and a CVS. Lots of casual as well as fancier restaurants. Some of the reviews complained about noise. When we had the windows open, we could hear sirens from the various hospitals, but we didn't hear anything with our windows closed. The pool and hot tub were clean. Breakfast (continental) was included and was clean and nicely provisioned (cereal, make your own waffles, bagels, muffins, danishes, juice, coffee, milk, oatmeal, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, fruit). There was plenty of it! Parking is $6 a night, which seemed a good deal to us. It's not fancy, nor is it romantic, but it was a great home base for us as we explored San diego with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeding Expectations”
Reviews.Author: jesterline
Reviews.Content: Sommerset Suites definitely exceeded my expectations. I wasn't expecting the suite to be quite as big as it was. I also was VERY pleased with the comfort level of the bed. It was better than some of the higher end hotels I've stayed in. The room and bathroom were both very clean. Also, one little thing that I thought was awesome was the microwave popcorn and complimentary water. Little freebies like that really make me happy :) The only downside to the place is that if you are expecting a quiet night's rest, you probably won't get it. The general area is a little noisy. I was there to go out though, so it wasn't a problem for me.

Reviews.Title: “Sommerset Stes. Consistently Pleases!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestKC
Reviews.Content: About 3-4 times a year I come to SD for family issues. Sommerset Stes. is MY place to stay!! Whether I've come with my husband, my sister, my daughter and grandson, or by myself...I always know to expect consistent attentive & professional service here. The rooms are BIG...a one-bedroom suite, especially if booked online, is a GREAT value! Martha does a super job maintaining the FREE breakfast area...and you can always practice your Spanish with her!! She is a very patient 'teacher'!! I have heard other accents here, too...Swedish, German, etc., so it is a fave of Europeans too!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, Emergency department across the road”
Reviews.Author: cocopops89
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and only heard 1 or 2 sirens. The rooms are very nice. Clean. Safe hotel. There are amazing restaurants only a block away. The hotel is not too far from the San Diego Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “A clean no-frills, good-value hotel in a nice area away from the harbor”
Reviews.Author: LookoutRanch
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a block from the main restaurant area of trendy downtown Hillcrest and maybe two miles on easy surface streets from Balboa Park/San Diego Zoo. There are lots of nice restaurants within a couple of blocks, but it's a long way from the harbor, Gas Light District, stadium and the main downtown tourist sections of San Diego. The hotel is an older, well-kept building and not built like a traditional hotel. It's more like a four-story motel. It's simple, neat and clean with no frills. The rooms are fairly spacious and many (if not all) have private decks. It feels secure and the area is safe. There's quite a bit of traffic noise from the busy street out front, but it gets quieter at night. It's near a hospital, so sirens are frequent. The hotel is probably used by visiting doctors and the family members of patients. It has that utilitarian feel. We went to San Diego to meet up with some family members staying in nearby university housing, so we selected the hotel primarily for its location. We weren't looking for amenities. We just wanted a clean, convenient place to stay, and this turned out to be a good choice for that. The staff at the desk were very professional and friendly. They make the hotel seem a bit more upscale than it really is.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: tomo0905
Reviews.Content: Nice room, good service, good amenities for the price. Excellently located in the heart of Hillcrest within walkable distance to many restaurants, etc., I highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good value--great price, good location, comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: RedNYGirl
Reviews.Content: We stay here every time we come to visit relatives in San Diego. The hotel is an exceptionally good value for the money. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, and the kitchenettes help you save money if you're cooking in. The free breakfasts are great (Belgian waffles, hard boiled eggs, etc), as is the location if you're not big on driving everywhere. You can walk to all the restaurants and shops in the Hillcrest area. It's true that the hotel is not in a terribly scenic spot (most of the rooms look out on construction sites or on the hospital), and it's not exactly full of old-world charm. Nevertheless, it's clean, convenient, and pleasant. The folks at the front desk are nice, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: cupertino_dude
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night late December. Suite was very roomy. Breakfast was excellent. We arrived late, and getting to the lobby was a bit odd. The lobby is actually above the parking area, and all entries were closed/locked. We had to get buzzed in. But once inside, the hotel was warm and welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, roomy rooms, super location”
Reviews.Author: Mooney051
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff who treated guests warmly, responded quickly to any need, from maids to front desk. There seemed to be many regular guests treated like family. Superb location in Hillcrest neighborhood, within blocks of lots of interesting restaurants, great walking area plus convenient to freeways and all of San Diego (three grocery stores within minutes). One bedroom suite was roomy, with sofa and dining table (big TV's in LR & BR); we entertained family one afternoon (six in all) very comfortably. Parking is $6, an incredible bargain compared to most urban hotels, and while the parking spaces are small (which I saw others complain about before I booked), they are do-able & I won't complain at this price vs. $20 or $30 per day at others, plus staff was accommodating of visitors' parking. Very very pet friendly place with easy access to walking your dog right outside the hotel. Some of the furnishings are a bit worn (bathroom cabinets, end tables), but not the rugs or upholstered furniture, which seemed very clean & almost new. Rooms were very very clean. I checked lots of San Diego hotels before I booked and, after staying there, felt it was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: adamchand
Reviews.Content: Everything went very well at this hotel.Its in a good location. Felt safe. Was not a long walk to many areas.Lots of nice shops and food nearby. Front desk was very attentive and nice.We used the hot tub and had nice breakfasts in the breakfast room. The bed was fluffy and the room good sized. Didnt use the kitchen area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: mengxiangjia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sommerset with two young kids. The room is spacious and cleaning. I like their big dinning table so that we can have meals and I can still space for my laptop. Staff are friendly. quick reaction to my call for help/service. The maids cleaned the room thoroughly, except one day. Location of the hotel is good. close to lots of visitor places.

Reviews.Title: “in SD, you just can't top it!”
Reviews.Author: bubu4us
Reviews.Content: Just a block off the 163, but quiet & serene, the Sommerset is superbly managed. Not only is it a great bargain for a suite with generous amenities, it is 1-2 blocks from some of San Diego's best restaurants. Rooms are immaculate, personnel know how to please and solve travel issues -- these are some of the reasons why my wife and I usually spend four nights every year at this premier establishment. If your interest is the SD zoo, I know of no other hotel that can get you there faster.

Reviews.Title: “I had a wonderful time!!”
Reviews.Author: amberwaits
Reviews.Content: The room was was very nice and big. I loved the way it looked like an apartment. It made me feel like I was as home. The staff was very pleanant and helpful. I love the location and it was easy to find and get access to. I will stay there again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: shurtliffp
Reviews.Content: Sommerset Suites are centrally located in San Diego....great for sight seeing! Rooms are beautiful and very comfortable! I felt very at ease. Staff was very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: Aviatorstarboy
Reviews.Content: After searching trip advisor for locations in San Diego for a hotel near downtown and Hillcrest area we settled on the Sommmerset, and we are glad we did. It is all the extras that they provide, the great welcome by Bonita, and assistace from Mathew, the welcome Managers reception at pool side, and the super comfy bed. The location is great, and right near the freeway (yes a bit of traffic noise) so easy to access. The extra size of the suite was perfect, as was the kitchen layout with all the utinsiles. Towels all folded like flowers, the cleanliness, and great breakfast buffet with waffles was something we will come back to for sure. Thanks again Sommerset for putting on a great welcome and keeping up to your high standard!! Well done!

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: rjinbigd
Reviews.Content: The location is great if you're looking to stay in Hillcrest area. We always stay here for a night or two when we travel to San Diego. Easy on/off the highway(s), convenient walking distance to shopping, dining and clubs. Great friendly staff that are always accomodating and helpful. The beds and bedding are awesome! Great breakfast with friendly service around the pool. I would highly recommend! *The only special request I make is to have a room opposite the street because the hotel is right next to a hospital and the ambulances can get annoying~ but they always accomodate and move us to which ever room we request.

Reviews.Title: “Ohhh those afternoon cookies!”
Reviews.Author: jbsimek
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Sommerset Suites several times and are always greeted by super friendly staff, a clean room, and the option to breakfast in or, enjoy Sommerset's free breakfast. All of this at an affordable rate in a convenient location!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PENNY21_10
Reviews.Content: great location, good space for family, very clean, great staff all very helpful, rooms and beds very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “It was really big pleasure to stay in this hotel with helpful cheerful personal”
Reviews.Author: rozensht
Reviews.Content: We have rich experience to stay in different hotels over the world but here it felt very different very warm almost like in big family everybody are very friendly. You always felt that people who worked in this hotel are not just doing their job but they like what they are doing and think about making your stay more comfortable and pleasant If i come to San Diego again i am definitely going to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another incredible stay!”
Reviews.Author: L0veTravel66
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying here and it was just as great as the first and second times. For a hotel this spotless, spacious, and comfortable you would really expect to pay 3 times as much. Matt, Bonita, and the others at the front desk, as usual, went out of their way to make sure all was good, and Martha in the breakfast room is just outstanding, a real asset to the hotel. We'll be back again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near Hillcrest!”
Reviews.Author: Davensj
Reviews.Content: The hotel makes it very convenient to walk to Hillcrest. This is the only hotel I use. I've always been impressed with the friendliness of the staff. It's great customer service all the way. The continental breakfast are very nice. The rooms are clean and decent size.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable with the feeling of being in own apartment.”
Reviews.Author: TampaFolks
Reviews.Content: We loved the suite, especially the full kitchen with cutlery, plates, pans, etc. It was larger than our first 1 BR apt.! A covered parking lot also available. Also had free Wifi and continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! I have found the perfect hotel for us!!!!!!! never stay anywhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: illios
Reviews.Content: So my hubby and i traveled with out 6 young children to san diego. From the moment i walked into the room i knew i made a great choice! Everything was super clean, the room was spacious. The hotel was super quiet! I felt like we were the only ones there! The breakfast was soooooooooooooo nice, and great when feeding 6 kids! they had so much variety! Waffles, toast, fruit, juice, oatmeal, eggs, yogurt! So much variety, the lady helping there her name is Martha, and let me tell you, she is the sweetest, kindess lady you willl ever meet! she is super helpful and caring and kind, i just cant say enough about her! We cant wait to go back!! The parkin lot i can see how ppl will say is small, but we drive a 12 passenger van and we managed to get in and out without problems... I was a bit concerned bout reading that there was a hosptal across the street....but we NEVER heard one siren at night...only a couple during the day which was NO big deal!! I just cant say enough bout this hotel..the staff, the rooms, the location of this hotel, perfect , perfect, perfect! we will be going back to san diego in a few months and i cant wait to book agai with this hotel!!!!!!! the only recommendation/suggestion i have is to get the food network channel on the cable list!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family”
Reviews.Author: mina0770
Reviews.Content: Sommerset suites hotel is perfect for family. Our room is very large with a full furnihed kitchen and very clean. In the afternoon they offer cookies and on friday they offer bbq in the swimmingpool. The stuff is very kind and the location is excellent. Breakfast is very good and rich and waiter is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bquetano
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, great to have the breakfast option, and the breakfast room workers were very friendly and helpful. Good staff, we stayed 4 nights, great location. Mattress needs to be upgraded, otherwise, everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “I've already booked another stay at the Sommerset”
Reviews.Author: stonebobbo
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot so I've seen it all. But this was just a fabulous experience. I should first say that I am a fan of Pacifica Hotels and look for them when I stay on the coast of California. But what a little gem the Sommerset Suites turned out to be. From the very first moment we walked into the lobby, we KNEW it was going to be a good stay. The front desk was very pleasant, and pointed us to the good (and away from the mediocre) restaurants right around the hotel ... and there are an abundance of them in all types and colors within walking distance of a couple of blocks.. The suite itself was spacious, clean, and way more appointed than the price would indicate. Really nice linens, more than enough high quality towels and product in the bathroom, and comfortable sitting in the living room. I'm not much of a TV watcher, so the older tube TVs didn't bother me much ... but I did appreciate the breadth of channels, including Speed (so I could watch the F1 race!). But having an efficiency kitchen and dining table are much appreciated. Of course, during our short visit there we didn't use it besides making coffee because the hotel had a tremendous free BBQ by the pool on the evening we were there, with really good, high-quality food. It was the real deal, not just some lame burgers and weiners ... but a really nice spread of a variety of food and free beer, wine and margaritas. The staff that were working that evening all participated, and acted as though we were guests in their home and visited with everyone and made sure everything was perfect. They succeeded. And then the free breakfast the next morning was more of the same ... with arm boiled eggs, beautiful fresh fruit, nice granola and yogurt, juices, great coffee, toast and pastries. Plus the fresh Belgian waffles ... and the staff that was on hand were helping everyone with the waffle machines to make sure that the normal screw-ups that happen all the time at other hotels were NOT going to make for a disaster at the Sommerset. Can you tell that I was impressed? Way more than I EVER expected, even though I have come to expect nothing short of excellent from Pacifica Hotels. So I have already booked for three days later this month when I need to be back in San Diego. One note for your light sleepers ... this hotel is in the midst several hospitals, so there are many ambulances/sirens that you might hear. But if you are accustomed to being in an urban environment, then you should have no issues.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: sk602
Reviews.Content: We had 4 adults staying in a 1 bedroom, 2 bed suite. Full kitchen, nice balcony, beds were comfy except for the sleeper sofa. Parking is $6/night and can be tight but we didn't have any problems. But the very best thing about this hotel is the location. It is located in Hillcrest just blocks from great restaurants and clubs. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms and Unbelievable Service”
Reviews.Author: muellerjja
Reviews.Content: The bedroom suites where huge for me and my family. For a reasonable price and great location, you can't beat the prices of other hotels. We had a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen. The housekeeping would come in and do your dishes for you including the normal cleaning. They had a great breakfast bar in the mornings with guest services assisting you with your food selections so you could relax. I recommend everyone who wants 5 star service for 3 star prices to check out sommerset.

Reviews.Title: “We've been coming to Sommerset Suites for 20 years and it's better than ever.”
Reviews.Author: cqibaxter
Reviews.Content: We started coming to Sommerset Suites before our son was born. We did a lot of daytime activity and lots of nightlife. The location of the Sommerset was perfect for all our needs. We enjoyed having the kitchen facilities and found having the king bed suite was very comfortable for hanging out in the living room, and the separate bedroom made it very quiet for sleeping. The patio area with the shallow pool and the jacuzzi is great for kids and adults alike. Our son, who's now 13, has grown up vacationing in San Diego and thinks of the Sommerset as another home. The staff, always friendly and warm, have added a lot to the "homey" feeling, in addition to being completely accomodating and helpful. Breakfast is served daily and now there is a summertime Friday night barbeque, which I'm told, may continue into the fall and winter. The rates are extremely reasonable and we wouldn't stay anywhere else. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JSlaughter
Reviews.Content: Full kitchens (with dishes, a small assortment of pots/pans and utensils), comfortable rooms, luxurious bedding, outstanding customer service, well appointed bathrooms. We love the freebies (cookies and fruit-laced water in the lobby, granola bars, microwave popcorn, and bottled waters in the rooms). Good location, even with the hospital across the street. All our needs have been attended to every time we've stayed, and it's become our go-to hotel when we travel to San Diego. I can't speak highly enough about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay location!”
Reviews.Author: Tazzracr
Reviews.Content: If you have a family the Sommerset Suites work out great. The rooms are very nice and at a considerable value. Close to all of the major freeways it makes it easy to get around. Close to SeaWorld, Seaport Village and Old Town San Diego. The staff goes out of their way to make sure your stay is most enjoyable and if there is an issue they are quick to take care of the problem. We have stayed at this establishment multiple times and will continue to do so with the great experiences we have had. I would recommend this to anyone, but especially to those that are looking for a central location at a reasonable price with large rooms and thick walls (great if you have small kids).

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: tommym2u
Reviews.Content: Checked in only to find out that the two dbl bed room I reserved/paid for was "under maintenance" I was given a room with one bed. All the prior visits I stayed in a one bedroom suite just like the one pictured on the website.. not this time; a very small room which looked like something from the 1970's, very old and out dated and small. I was told that all or my prior visits I must have had "the luck of the draw getting one of the rooms pictured on the website. I feel cheated and that Sommerset was/is very deceitful. If you MUST stay in Hillcrest, OK, if not... RUN to the numerous hotels in San Diego that offier much better room at better prices.

Reviews.Title: “A Most Excellent Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jility
Reviews.Content: After spending WAY too much time online searching for the right place to stay, I booked the Sommerset. The reason was the value compared to the others in the area. Parking costs $6.00 per night but the others close by were $22. A night! The Hillcrest District is awesome!!! Great food and everything you could ever want. There is a movie theater around the corner and it is within walking distance to the hospitals and doctors. The staff were friendly and helpful and I LOVED the fruited water in the lobby! The parking is very tight but there is an overflow lot for oversized vehicles. Unfortunately, my GPS kept trying to take me to the OTHER 606 Washington a mile in the other direction so I had some trouble finding it without the hotelâ€™s help. They could use larger TVs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: orlandruiz
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service. The manager and staff went way beyond their duties to get me the room I wanted and the stuff I needed in my room. It is rare to find service like that anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Sommerset was an excellent choice!!”
Reviews.Author: explorer50uk
Reviews.Content: My adult son, daughter and myself have just spent 4 days at Sommerset Suites, we were given a corner room (115) on the lobby floor but 1 floor up from the street. This room was huge!! the bedroom had 2 large comfortable beds while the living are had an adequate sofa bed. The room was very clean, there was a nice balcony, and we were able to open the windows (screened) at night. Full size refrigerator, stove and a dishwasher. Laundry room was very reasonably priced on the 4th floor. There was breakfast (continental) but again, very adequate with waffles, toast, boiled eggs and very good coffee!! The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We did not get to use the pool which I believe was heated but again it was all very well kept and clean. Parking was a good deal at $6 per night.
